verb.description: Share or exchange information, news, or ideas.
examples: the prisoner was forbidden to communicate with his family

verb.description: Pass on (an infectious disease) to another person or animal.
(of two rooms) have a common connecting door.
examples: he went into the communicating room to pick up the phone

origin: Early 16th century: from Latin communicat- shared, from the verb communicare, from communis (see common).
